repnme.cdata!: Burkina Faso - Energy Sector Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Power Sector Development
            Project for Africa were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: It is difficult to foresee and calculate
            the impact of externalities such as political risk, thus
            appropriate mitigating measures should be identified. Sector
            reforms should be pursued in parallel with investments.
            Institutional arrangements should involve few entities if
            possible. Thorough assessment of fiduciary and safeguard
            capacity of coordinating/implementing structures is
            necessary during project preparation and appropriate
            mitigation measures implemented to avoid implementation
            delays. Realistic estimation of components’ costs at
            preparation. Simplicity and clarity in project design.
            Financial covenants should be realistic relative to the
            client’s capacity.

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Power Sector Development
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Power
            Sector Development Project for Burkina Faso are to: (i)
            enhance the policy and institutional environment for
            efficient sector development and operation; (ii) improve the
            availability and reliability of electricity supply in the
            area covered by the national utility SONABEL (Societe
            Nationale d'Electricite du Burkina - National Power
            Utility); and (iii) promote rational and efficient use of
            energy in public buildings through demand-side management
            initiatives. This restructuring will update the results
            framework for the Project and amend the Development Grant
            Agreement for this purpose.  In July 2011, the project
            benefited from a twelve month extension of the grant closing
            date to July 30, 2012 and a reallocation of funds within the
            original project description.  The restructuring aims at:
            (a) formalizing the inclusion during the 2011 restructuring
            of a new core indicator which estimates the number of direct
            beneficiaries (including the number of women); and (b)
            correcting an output indicator target which was modified
            during the project's mid-term review but not formalized.

            Development Project : restructuring  : Main report
